did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Slides, photographs, and papers concering Matyas' career in facilities at Cornell, including his work on the Superconducting Super Collider, the Laboratory of Nuclear Studies, the Wilson Synchrotron Laboratory, Arecibo Ionospheric Observatory, and various other campus buildings.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Vice-President for Facilities and Business Operations, Cornell University.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Slides, photographs, and papers concering Matyas' career in facilities at Cornell, including his work on the Superconducting Super Collider, the Laboratory of Nuclear Studies, the Wilson Synchrotron Laboratory, Arecibo, and various other campus buildings.
Also, Arecibo photographs by Dale Corson, photographs of Jason Seley sculptures, photographs of the Uris Library addition, other Arecibo and campus scenes, including glass negatives of the Arts Quad.

Also, "Living units for men, Cornell University," 1951, architecture student project report about dormitories at Cornell, by Robert D. Katz, Robert M. Matyas, John I. Williams, and Carlton S. Young; "Some Things I Remember about the Anabel Taylor Interfaith Chapel at Cornell University," 2012

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Robert Matyas papers, #43-01-3368. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

scopecontent.p: Harry Burgess, Wisconsin Trip, Tunnel, Isle of Shoals (1980), Commencement (1981), Manchester, NH (1981), Cape Cod (1981), Performing Arts Center, Observatory, Bill Hamilton, Arecibo Main Cable Inspection, Cornell Club in NYC, Toronto, Cornell University Medical College, Cornell University Heating Plant, Ithaca Gun, Cornell University Football, World Trade Center (Feb. 1987), New York City, California (1987), Chicago, Atlanta (Feb. 1987), Baker Laboratory, Washington, DC, Uris Library Addition, Cornell University Construction, Mining, Massachusetts Avenue House in Washington, DC, Geology Building Construction, Sab Micron Lab, Day Hall, VCAT, Sibley Hall, Mrs. Robert Purcell, St. Lawrence River, Pew Quad Dedication (1980), Cornell University Career Center, Statler West, Risley Hall, East Avenue, Nick Noyes, Indianapolis, Boston, assorted Cornell University views, assorted Arecibo views, and miscellaneous shots as well as slides of the following: New York City, Cornell University Construction, Performing Arts Center, Statler, Cornell University Medical College, Olin Library Construction, Uris Library, assorted Cornell University views, assorted Arecibo views, and assorted Ithaca views
